Honestly this game has a huge learning curve so if youre willing to put in time and effort to learn strategies, perks, and communication it will be worth the effort. As a killer main, you have to expect people getting mad and leaving comments on your profile bc this game's fanbase can be toxic lol. I feel like being killer is harder than survivor but it really depends on your playstyle. Overall fun and a big investment of time and effort.

The premise of the game is one of a kind. Though I don't have enough experience to be as concise as I could be, with the few hours I have put into this product, I can whole heartedly recommend this game to individuals that not only enjoy a rush of thrill and adrenaline, a refined auditory experience, a grindy leveling system, and fun and engaging gameplay. I am sure that I will enjoy this game for a long time.

Game is good, at first I was kinda scared to play killer because I didn't want to lose and have someone say "haha baby killer ez go play a different game" but then it was easy and i won.

I'd love to say I used to enjoy this game, but the fact of the matter is that in a game like this, enjoyment is tied too closely to the community of the game and this game has BY FAR the MOST TOXIC community I have ever encountered in any game. 

Both survivors and killers alike constantly troll you; teabagging, camping singular jump points, guarding hooked survivors, deliberately blocking pathways, picking up survivors only to put them down because they wish to waste your time, not helping other survivors, sending myriads of hatemail to other players.

It should come as no surprise that the game designed as a power fantasy for serial killers just attracts assholes and psychopaths, who either take the game way too seriously, or not seriously at all and deliberately ruin the experience for others.

What does come as a surprise is that a company that updates their game so often does almost nothing to punish trolling. 

In short, this game is great in theory, but its utterly toxic community makes it infuriating to play.

On top of this, they added a battlepass system, which I vehemently oppose merely on principle as it is the mark of a greedy developer. 

If I could refund the game, I would, purely on principle. But since I can't, the most I can do is discourage anyone else from buying this pile of shit, which will invariably ruin your day.
This game is worth $20, nuff said.
Playing with friends and cross-play is worth it=)

This is an awesome game and even better with friends. There is toxicity every now and then but happens in every game. Me and my buddies can play this game for hours at a time. Just be ready to invest some time in this game to get pretty decent at it. However, despite some reviews, the new matchmaking system works pretty well and I rarely have unbalanced games. 10/10
